title: Would you steal £5,000 from the homeless? YouTube star sets up social experiment with interesting results
text:

A social experiment set up by a YouTube star aimed to see how the people of London would behave if they saw a wad of cash unattended next to a homeless man . 
And the results were unexpected to say the least. 
James Slattery decided to see how the public would react if they spotted £5,000 left next to the sleeping man. 
Dressing up as an Arab prince, the notorious YouTube prankster from Ireland - who was responsible for the Honey G stage invasion on the X Factor - opened up a suitcase and took out wads of fake cash. The 'rich' Arab man leaves a wad of cash in full view of the public (Photo: YOUTUBE/ James Slattery) 
He then left the money next to a 'sleeping' homeless man in several different areas around London. 
First, the money was left next to a man in a subway. 
The homeless man appeared to be sound asleep under several layers of blankets and did not stir as the Arab man placed the money by his head. 
Moments later, two women spotted the cash and immediately headed over the the man. One woman helps the 'homeless man' to hide his money (Photo: YOUTUBE/ James Slattery) Read More Cruel lout urinated on homeless man as he tried to sleep outside railway station 
After gathering the money in their hands, they then proceeded to hide it under some of the pieces of cardboard the man was using to sleep on. 
In a second scenario, the money was left by a group of people selling items on the street. 
One man with a bunch of bananas stared at the money for some time, before a woman eventually came over and helped to hide it under the man's sheets. Everyone in London was honest when confronted with the money (Photo: YOUTUBE/ James Slattery) 
But the most astounding show of kindness was in the third scenario, when the 'homeless man' was sleeping next to another man also struggling to find shelter. 
Instead of taking the money and making a run for it, the real homeless man woke the actor up to tell him about his unexpected windfall. Read More Actor who was a homeless drunk is reunited with Good Samaritan Another homeless man hands the money back to the actor (Photo: YOUTUBE/ James Slattery) 
Touched by the man's kindness, the YouTube actor tells him: "Do you know what, this is a social experiment. We've done three or four different scenarios today. 
A lot of honest people, but nobody homeless honest enough to give it back to me." 
The man replies: "Yeah honestly, he [the Arab man] said it was for you. He touched your shoulder and left it there." 
Baffled, the actor says: "I can't believe your homeless and you're actually giving it back to me." Like us on Facebook
